metadata.titel_preek: The Voice of the Son of Man

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Cosmic Christ intervenes in a fallen, apocalyptic world to gather His kingdom and defeat the powers of Death and Evil.

subject.identificatie: The Son of Man / The Cosmic Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: the final intervention of Christ the King
the Son of Man who is coming with the clouds

object.identificatie: The Kingdom of God / Redemption and Re-creation of the world
tekstueel_bewijs: gather in his kingdom from the ends of the universe
God's project of redemption and re-creation
the One who holds both the past and the future
the grand design of the Creator of the universe

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Hearers / Oppressed Peoples
tekstueel_bewijs: given confidence, courage, and hope to oppressed and subjugated peoples

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Unseen Heavenly Armies
tekstueel_bewijs: let his Holy Spirit do the work of convicting, converting, and consecrating
unseen horses and chariots of fire
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, and the Spirit is the internalizing Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that enables the hearer to respond.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Ruler of this World / Death / Cosmic Evil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an ontological power ('Death') that requires a divine warrior to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer lives out 'apocalyptic ethics'—small acts of faithfulness as signs of the coming kingdom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Small Group
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Acts of mercy / Signs of the kingdom
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is a response to being 'seized' by the primary program. Ethics flow from the eschatological reality.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Son also to have life in himself
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we act as if it were our last act
we feel more comfortable talking about the love of God

voorbeelden: we simply must ask questions about it
aspirations and struggles of the young strivers
Behold, I have told you all things beforehand
you will be given courage and strength
nothing can lie beyond the power of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God which grants 'Pouvoir' to the incompetent human subject.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the false security of ~S2 (optimism) to the reality of S2 (tribulation), finally resolved in S1 (Christ's victory).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the weight of S2 to establish S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; sin and death are treated as cosmic enemies.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are those who are 'seized' and 'warned.'

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is accomplishing his purposes in spite of all appearances
The ruler of this world... will not go down without a battle.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples but as witnesses to God's action.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Elisha's servant (as witness to God's power)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The focus remains on the 'unseen horses' (God's power) rather than the servant's character.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and courage; the burden of history is shifted to God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is an act of God's 'seizing' the heart.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic victory of Christ to the small acts of the church is perfectly integrated via 'apocalyptic ethics.'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The transition from this world to the coming reign of God will not happen without a fight to the death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'consecrates' and 'converts,' providing the 'Pouvoir' the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to 'Death' and 'Satan,' not just moral failure.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's eschatological intervention. The hearer is positioned as a beneficiary and witness.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the apocalyptic theme.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids moralism by keeping God as the primary Subject of the apocalyptic drama.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'goose bumps' and imagery, Greimas reveals that the actual 'engine' of the sermon is Christ's agency, not the preacher's persuasion.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Mark 13; this analysis shows how Mark 13 is functionally applied to the hearer's identity as a 'Receiver.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'apocalyptic ethics' section is not a new mandate (Devoir) but a participation in God's already-active project (Pouvoir).

appendices.notnotes: The sermon explicitly rejects 'easy humanism' and 'moral progress,' reinforcing the structural shift toward a Grace-oriented model.
